t: Luke 9
Then*p he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.
And*p he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
And*p he said unto them, Take*r nothing*r for*r your*r journey,*r neither*r staves,*r nor*r scrip,*r neither*r bread,*r neither*r money;*r neither*r have*r two*r coats*r apiece.*r
And*rp whatsoever*r house*r ye*r enter*r into,*r there*r abide,*r and*r thence*r depart.*r
And*rp whosoever*r will*r not*r receive*r you,*r when*r ye*r go*r out*r of*r that*r city,*r shake*r off*r the*r very*r dust*r from*r your*r feet*r for*r a*r testimony*r against*r them.*r
And*p they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.
Now*p Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;
And*p of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.
And*p Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.
And*p the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done. And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.
And*p the people, when they knew it, followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.

And*p when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.
But*p he said unto them, Give*r ye*r them*r to*r eat.*r And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.
For*p they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make*r them*r sit*r down*r by*r fifties*r in*r a*r company.*r
And*p they did so, and made them all sit down.
Then*p he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.
And*p they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.
And*p it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom*r say*r the*r people*r that*r I*r am?*r
They*p answering said, John the Baptist; but some say, Elias; and others say, that one of the old prophets is risen again.
He*p said unto them, But*r whom*r say*r ye*r that*r I*r am?*r Peter answering said, The Christ of God.
And*p he straitly charged them, and commanded them to tell no man that thing;

Saying,*p The*r Son*r of*r man*r must*r suffer*r many*r things,*r and*r be*r rejected*r of*r the*r elders*r and*r chief*r priests*r and*r scribes,*r and*r be*r slain,*r and*r be*r raised*r the*r third*r day.*r
And*p he said to them all, If*r any*r man*r will*r come*r after*r me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross*r daily,*r and*r follow*r me.*r
For*rp whosoever*r will*r save*r his*r life*r shall*r lose*r it:*r but*r whosoever*r will*r lose*r his*r life*r for*r my*r sake,*r the*r same*r shall*r save*r it.*r
For*rp what*r is*r a*r man*r advantaged,*r if*r he*r gain*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r lose*r himself,*r or*r be*r cast*r away?*r

For*rp whosoever*r shall*r be*r ashamed*r of*r me*r and*r of*r my*r words,*r of*r him*r shall*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r be*r ashamed,*r when*r he*r shall*r come*r in*r his*r own*r glory,*r and*r in*r his*r Father's,*r and*r of*r the*r holy*r angels.*r
But*rp I*r tell*r you*r of*r a*r truth,*r there*r be*r some*r standing*r here,*r which*r shall*r not*r taste*r of*r death,*r till*r they*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*p it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.
And*p as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment was white and glistering.
And,*p behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:
Who*p appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.
But*p Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.

And*p it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.
While*p he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.
And*p there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
And*p when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they kept it close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.
And*p it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.
And,*p behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.
And,*p lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.
And*p I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.
And*p Jesus answering said, O*r faithless*r and*r perverse*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you,*r and*r suffer*r you?*r Bring*r thy*r son*r hither.*r
And*p as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tare him. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.
And*p they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,
Let*rp these*r sayings*r sink*r down*r into*r your*r ears:*r for*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r shall*r be*r delivered*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men.*r
But*p they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.
Then*p there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.
And*p Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,

And*p said unto them, Whosoever*r shall*r receive*r this*r child*r in*r my*r name*r receiveth*r me:*r and*r whosoever*r shall*r receive*r me*r receiveth*r him*r that*r sent*r me:*r for*r he*r that*r is*r least*r among*r you*r all,*r the*r same*r shall*r be*r great.*r
And*p John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.
And*p Jesus said unto him, Forbid*r him*r not:*r for*r he*r that*r is*r not*r against*r us*r is*r for*r us.*r
And*p it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,
And*p sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.
And*p they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.
And*p when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?
But*p he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye*r know*r not*r what*r manner*r of*r spirit*r ye*r are*r of.*r
For*rp the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r not*r come*r to*r destroy*r men's*r lives,*r but*r to*r save*r them.*r And they went to another village.
And*p it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain man said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
And*p Jesus said unto him, Foxes*r have*r holes,*r and*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r have*r nests;*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r hath*r not*r where*r to*r lay*r his*r head.*r
And*p he said unto another, Follow*r me.*r But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
Jesus*p said unto him, Let*r the*r dead*r bury*r their*r dead:*r but*r go*r thou*r and*r preach*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*p another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.
And*p Jesus said unto him, No*r man,*r having*r put*r his*r hand*r to*r the*r plough,*r and*r looking*r back,*r is*r fit*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
